test_cases.description: Patient readmitted with unrelated abdominal pain post scoliosis surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-01T11:00Z]: Patient was admitted for idiopathic scoliosis surgery. Following discharge, the patient returned with severe abdominal pain, which was determined to be unrelated to the surgical site. The surgical site was clean, dry, and intact with no signs of infection or complications. Patient's abdominal pain was attributed to a pre-existing condition.

required_provenance: Patient returned with severe abdominal pain, which was determined to be unrelated to the surgical site.

test_cases.description: Patient admitted for pre-existing condition unrelated to scoliosis surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-04T09:15Z]: Post scoliosis surgery, the patient was readmitted for a pre-existing GI condition, which was unrelated to the surgical procedure. Surgical site examination revealed no complications or signs of infection.

required_provenance: the patient was readmitted for a pre-existing GI condition, which was unrelated to the surgical procedure.

test_cases.description: Patient faced complications unrelated to the surgical site after discharge.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-05T12:00Z]: After discharge following scoliosis surgery, the patient was readmitted for respiratory distress due to asthma exacerbation, not related to surgery. Examination of the surgical site showed no issues.

required_provenance: the patient was readmitted for respiratory distress due to asthma exacerbation, not related to surgery.

test_cases.description: Patient experienced severe back pain unrelated to surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-02T09:00Z]: The patient presented with severe back pain upon admission. This pain appears to be unrelated to the surgical site, as there is no swelling or tenderness noted in the area of the recent surgery.

required_provenance: The patient presented with severe back pain upon admission.

test_cases.description: Patient with pain management issues post-surgery unrelated to surgical complications.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-05T16:45Z]: The patient is experiencing severe pain despite adequate analgesic regimen. Pain appears to be chronic and unrelated to the surgical site.

required_provenance: The patient is experiencing severe pain despite adequate analgesic regimen.

test_cases.description: Patient admitted for scoliosis surgery, later developed unrelated GI symptoms.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-02-01T09:00Z]: Patient is a 16-year-old female with a diagnosis of idiopathic scoliosis. She underwent posterior spinal fusion. Post-op, she exhibited abdominal pain and nausea which were assessed and found to be due to a pre-existing condition of gastritis, unrelated to her surgery.

test_cases.description: Post-operative patient with back pain attributed to muscle strain, no infection.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-02-02T14:30Z]: The patient presented with increased back pain following scoliosis surgery. Upon examination, the pain was determined to be due to muscle strain from postoperative activity rather than surgical site infection or hardware complication.

required_provenance: increased back pain following scoliosis surgery

test_cases.description: Patient returned for unrelated respiratory issue post scoliosis surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-02-03T11:15Z]: After a successful scoliosis correction surgery, the patient returned to the ER with complaints of shortness of breath. Examination revealed that the patient was suffering from asthma exacerbation, unrelated to her surgical procedure.

test_cases.description: Patient with pre-existing condition causing leg numbness post-surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-02-04T08:45Z]: The patient, a 15-year-old male, underwent scoliosis surgery. Post-op, he reported paresthesia in his left leg, which was ultimately attributed to pre-existing neuropathy rather than a surgical complication.

required_provenance: reported paresthesia in his left leg

test_cases.description: Patient admitted with abdominal pain unrelated to scoliosis surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-02T10:30Z]: Patient presented with severe abdominal pain and nausea, which began two days post-operatively. Surgical site review revealed no signs of infection, but the patient was experiencing discomfort due to a gastrointestinal obstruction unrelated to the scoliosis surgery.

required_provenance: gastrointestinal obstruction unrelated to the scoliosis surgery

test_cases.description: Patient develops respiratory distress unrelated to surgical intervention.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-05T15:00Z]: Patient exhibited signs of respiratory distress due to a pre-existing asthma condition, which was exacerbated by recent respiratory infection. The surgical site was stable and showed no signs of infection.

required_provenance: respiratory distress due to a pre-existing asthma condition

test_cases.description: Patient re-admitted for a non-surgical complication unrelated to the surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-07T12:00Z]: Patient was readmitted due to urinary tract infection (UTI) diagnosed two weeks post-operatively. No complications were noted at the surgical site, which was healing well.

required_provenance: urinary tract infection (UTI) diagnosed two weeks post-operatively

test_cases.description: Patient admitted for chronic condition flare-up unrelated to the surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-12T14:00Z]: Patient was admitted for a flare-up of a pre-existing autoimmune condition, which caused systemic symptoms. The surgical site was assessed and found to be within normal limits, with no signs of infection.

required_provenance: flare-up of a pre-existing autoimmune condition
